intro: Raphionacme inconspicua, commonly known as the inconspicuous raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils in open woodlands and pine flatwoods. It is a perennial herb that produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink and white. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
